pr_title: Qute if section - consider truthy/falsy values during evaluation

timeline.message:
Qute if section - consider truthy/falsy values during evaluation

- resolves #8582

timeline.bodyText:
BigInteger?
Also perhaps AtomicInteger and AtomicLong and AtomicDouble?
timeline.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: +1 for BigInteger. I'm not so sure about the atomic variants. I mean you can always test the current value...
replies.author: mkouba
Ladicek

replies.bodyText: Hm, number.longValue() == 0L || number.doubleValue() == 0.0d would not work. E.g. 0.2d would be considered falsy (the first condition is true) which is not correct. Or am I missing something?
replies.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText:
It's a trap and I probably shouldn't have suggested this :-) Because Atomic* numbers are also Numbers, so you'll have Double going through the doubleValue() path, while AtomicDouble going through the longValue() path :-)
In retrospective, this was probably a bad idea. (Too bad Number doesn't prescribe isZero!)
replies.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: Hm, what about using new java.math.BigDecimal(number.toString()) for any other numbers?
replies.author: mkouba
